channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @JeffreyASachs The fact you didn’t confess to either killing an elderly neighbor lady or rigging a student council election makes me doubt the accuracy of your transcript.
@emptywheel “Human extinction poses challenge to Republican messaging, some say.”

Your occasional reminder that “traditional Christian family values” involve burning members of my (extended) Jewish family to death. https://t.co/DOB13lmCKz
Let me know when Ross Douthat or any of the other trad cryptofascists on salary at the Times or the National Review or First Things come up with a heuristic to determine when government support of religion is good versus when it is bad.
@Alumna_Vassar @soledadobrien I hope Ross Douthat’s soon-to-be-ex wife is more interesting and less facile.
@GailLabovitz @TheRaDR So the perfect magazine columnist! (Other than not speaking English, and being dead lo these 1500 years or so….)
@onthemainline And then what happened?
We’ll know when there’s really a “New Middle East” when Arab media start releasing election projections embargoed by Israel’s similar Election Day laws. https://t.co/7jKlhgJdnW
Sure, their positions may be objectively ridiculous. But they are lionized by institutions like Yeshiva University and the Jewish Week. https://t.co/9HJ2ViTrH1
@rabbilaufer @WomansDay @TheRaDR @velveteenrabbi @womenrabbis @rabbikrp It better be Shmuley B.
@DBashIdeas Seems like my NCSY public school friends who drank beer and smoked pot back in the 80s (and occasionally on the Greyhound bus to Convention) knew what they were doing.
In which a twitter account normally devoted to amazing adventures with vintage computers is forced by inclement weather to venture into some amazing midrash. https://t.co/Ez1KfQGKhL
@datadivajf But equally unutterable in Florida schools.

Had a discussion with my Beloved Conservative Relative recently. He was trying to get me to concede that the Ten Commandments could form the basis for a just society.
I didn’t directly challenge him on his adoration of the Ten Commandments, whose flag we stopped waving, and whose words we generally stopped reciting, when the Christians came along and decided that they were the only part of the Torah that mattered.
I did though, point out that most people probably would object to one’s “neighbor’s wife” being part of a clause that also includes “neighbor’s donkey” — most people, after all, being female.
Fifty years ago, BCR was on the side voting for his Conservative congregation to call women to the Torah. Now, decades of Limbaugh and Fox brainwashing has put him closer to Team Taliban than he can understand. https://t.co/kXeCQ9n4uj
And as always, I'm left with the question of what is my moral obligation in undertaking the de-Nazification of my BCR.
Some interesting questions here. https://t.co/TtiaEyLBcj

@AlonPinkas Doesn’t get more beautiful than Jackie O, so I guess you’re right.
@AlonPinkas Not to mention Jematria.
@trekonomics My guess that it was better than anything else in Analog that month seems borne out by this review. https://t.co/8thcSM5lvH

@trekonomics Eugenics? In John Campbell’s Analog Magazine? I’m shocked!
@trekonomics I’m curious about all the SF book editors who rejected it. My guess is that it was less about the eugenics and more about the drugs, which is where Dune resonated with the 60s college culture more that the NYC publishing world.
@MisfitTorah So: Would Ryan North’s book have helped Jacob’s messianic mission?
@AshWritesBooks @Rockets2Writing Hmmm. Will consider this at @benyehudapress. Though probably will make it 3+ years because we only recently started tagging titles by pub date.
https://t.co/t8fGJOtUbF
@yaelevgi @DBashIdeas Loved that Political Dictionary. Inhaled the first volume when I was reporting from Jerusalem.
@DemocraticLuntz Not sure that True Belief is sufficient to atone for devotedly defrauding sick people. https://t.co/HiZjwr2ATW
@z3dster I’m sure he found Democrats to support his was on health and science. https://t.co/HiZjwr2ATW
@chadvasiloff @TrekMovie And memorial to all the Canadians killed in tragic transporter accidents.
@secupp Patron saint of snake oil grifters lives to 88. https://t.co/HiZjwr2ATW
